intro: Radiola, commonly known as starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Radiola has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
